This bug may won't fix, since it is caused by current architecture. BIRT 
designer and viewer will have their independent classloader to load plugins, so 
a driver will be loaded twice and its dll will be loaded twice too if it 
exists. However, there is a strict regulation that one JVM only can load one 
dll once. This can not be solved unless viewer will use the same classloader to 
load plugin as designer.

The problem mentioned in the comment was resolved. (Now in Eclipse environment, viewer uses Eclipse platform and loads plugins from Eclipse workspace/plugin folder instead of the viewer's plugin folder.) Reassigning the bug to the original owner for verification/further investigation as I don't have the test environment.
After the change of class loader mechanism of viewer, this bug is fixed.
